p: The Argan woodland is exploited for cereal crops, together with vegetables and legumes. Indeed, 90% of the rural economy in the region depends on argan-based agroforestry (Benchekroun and Buttoud 1989). In addition, the argan tree, the most remarkable tree of the landscape, provides a highly appreciated and expensive oil used in culinary, cosmetic, and medicinal purposes (Noua√Øm et al. 1991; El Monfalouti et al. 2010; Lybbert et al. 2011).
